reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid shampoo I’ve been using for years!
reviews.reviewText: I’ve had dry scalp with dandruff issues in the past, but after using this shampoo those issues came to a halt. Not only did this help with scalp and flake issues, my hair feels rejuvenated after every use. I’ve used this product for the last five years and refuse to use anything else. The only thing is that this shampoo is unscented (but I personally don’t mind).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2016
reviews.reviewText: While doing research on dandruff I ran across the Sachajuan Scalp shampoo and read all the reviews, some positive some negative; the negative ones mostly complaining about the cost of the product. I hesitated to buy the product until I realized what I was paying for my dandruff shampoo which was not working was $5.00 cheaper about a 15% difference; so i ordered the shampoo.When it arrived, the bottle was nice and I smelled it, not too much fragrance and it looked like baby shampoo or other commercial shampoos and I was not initially impressed; but of course I shampooed my hair with it. It has a mild clean smell which is great for me since I don't like strong fragrances. I got some in my eye and let me tell you, this is not a "no more tears" formula. Followed the instructions on the label and I have to say that I think the product is a miracle. Immediately my scalp felt better and i stopped itching and flaking. I know it is too good to be true but this was my experience. I was going to alternate between this and my other dandruff shampoo but i have not gone back to the other. I am using it every three days or so, about twice a week and it has not dried out my hair but at first I did use a conditioner, now I am not. My dandruff has not come back and I use it on my beard and my eyebrows (carefully).There is a doubt that this was a seasonal effect and that perhaps my dandruff would return in the winter, however my dandruff was never seasonal, but I will wait and see what happens then. For now I am very happy that decided to go for it and I have recommended it to friends. It is great to be able to wear dark clothes and not worry about the flakes. BTW I just realized that the bottle contains 250 ML which is 50ML more than my older shampoo so essentially they are the same price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great product, disappointing protective property
reviews.reviewText: I have no issues with the product itself, it works Wonderfully with my scalp and I love the smell. The only issue I have is that there is no security seal on the product upon arrival.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cleared up the worst dandruff I’ve ever had
reviews.reviewText: I can’t remember how I stumbled upon this product, but about a year ago I had the worst dandruff I’ve ever had. I normally don’t have any so it was really a surprise that one day it looked like it was snowing from my head. It was so bad that I was nervous of getting haircut and having them think something was wrong with my scalp! After seeing that I did the first thing most people would do: go to the store and buy some head and shoulders. After using that for a couple of weeks, I didn’t notice any improvement. I then tried tea tree oil, but didn’t notice any improvement there either. I made an appointment with my dermatologist and she prescribed me shampoo, but I didn’t notice any improvement there either. I scoured the internet and somehow ran into this. It was expensive, but I was pretty desperate so I bit the bullet and gave it try. Within a few days it started getting better. My sister recommended I use the Aussie 3 minute miracle stuff for conditioner as well. Between those two I have not had any dandruff in a year. Now, I did move to California and had run out of this stuff but I did still have my conditioner so I used Dove moisturizing shampoo for a week, but sure enough my scalp was dry and the dandruff was coming back. I freaked out and bought this all over again. I will probably never switch. This story really works or at least it really did for me.The scent isn’t great as I like a fruity sort of smell to my shampoos and it does not lather as much as say the Dove did, but the results and lack of dandruff are too good to ignore for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My daughter had dandruff and oily hair for years. She has very think hair so this made it extra tough to manage. Her hair and scalp LOVE this shampoo! Oil and dandruff were corrected with one wash. After several washes, hair is smoother and shiner. We will be sticking with this for as long as it’s available!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Doesn't create a good lather
reviews.reviewText: While this product does make you strands feel squeaky clean, its hard to get a good lather. I felt like I had to use a lot of product and consequently went through this bottle pretty quickly. Honestly, just feel like there are better options for the price. Not a great value - which would be fine if the product was remarkable. It is just pretty meh.I will not be buying this product again. I much prefer the Honeydew Biotin Shampoo & Conditioner to this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is the best shampoo for dandruff hands down!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The only product that helps with itchy and oily hair
reviews.reviewText: This is the only product that helps with an itchy and oily hair condition of one of the family members. It is pricy, but at least it works.
Love this but too ex. Neutrogena T/Sal is much better for super oily scalps.

Scent was fine, but it made no difference other than to absolutely strip and dry out my hair. I'd rather use a less-drying shampoo and skip conditioner than use this. But it does really cut through a greasy scalp like nothing else.
